definition.name: NXspecdata
definition.doc:
Data collected by SPEC control and data acquisition software
SPEC [#]_ is software for instrument control and data acquisition in X-ray diffraction experiments.
.. [#] SPEC: https://certif.com

attribute.name: default
attribute.doc:
.. index:: plotting
Declares which :ref:`NXentry` group contains the data to be shown by default. It is needed to resolve ambiguity when more than one :ref:`NXentry` group exists. The value is the name of the default :ref:`NXentry` group.

attribute.name: HDF5_Version
attribute.doc:
Version of HDF5 library used in writing the file (as specified in :ref:`NXroot`).
Note this attribute is spelled with uppercase "V", different than other version attributes.

attribute.name: h5py_version
attribute.doc: version of h5py Python package used to write this HDF5 file

attribute.name: SPEC_file
attribute.doc: original SPEC data file name from **#F** line in file header

attribute.name: SPEC_date
attribute.doc: date from **#D** line in file header, in ISO8601 format

attribute.name: SPEC_epoch
attribute.doc: UNIX time epoch from **#E** line in file header

attribute.name: SPEC_comments
attribute.doc: any **#C** lines in file header, stored as one string with newlines between comments

attribute.name: SPEC_num_headers
attribute.doc: Number of header sections found in the spec file

group.doc: one scan from a SPEC data file, starts with a **#S** line

attribute.name: default
attribute.doc:
.. index:: plotting
Declares which :ref:`NXdata` group contains the data to be shown by default. It is needed to resolve ambiguity when more than one :ref:`NXdata` group exists. The value is the name of the default :ref:`NXdata` group.

field.name: definition
field.doc: Official NeXus NXDL schema to which this subentry conforms.

field.name: scan_number
field.doc: SPEC scan number

field.name: title
field.doc:
SPEC scan number and command, from **#S** line
SPEC data file line::
#S 1 cscan en 690 750 60 0
*title*::
1 cscan en 690 750 60 0

field.name: command
field.doc:
SPEC scan command, from **#S** line, after the scan number.
:SPEC data file line: ``#S 1 cscan en 690 750 60 0``
:command*: ``cscan en 690 750 60 0``

field.name: date
field.doc: date from **#D** line in scan header, in ISO8601 format

field.name: mode
field.doc: Count to a preset value based on either clock time (timer) or received monitor counts (monitor).

field.name: preset
field.doc:
preset value for time or monitor
* **#M** -- counting against this constant monitor count (see #T) * **#T** -- counting against this constant number of seconds (see #M)

field.name: data
field.doc: array(s) of monitor data

field.name: count_time
field.doc: array(s) of monitor data

field.name: comments
field.doc: Any **#C** lines in this scan, stored as one string with newlines between comments

field.name: Q
field.doc:
**#Q** -- :math:`Q` (:math:`hkl`) at start of scan
array of [:math:`h` :math:`k` :math:`l`]

field.name: TEMP_SP
field.doc: **#X** -- temperature set point

field.name: DEGC_SP
field.doc: **#X** -- temperature set point (C)

group.name: data
group.doc: detector (and MCA) data from this scan

attribute.name: signal
attribute.doc:
name of the field with the plottable data, typically the last column for 1-D scans
This is the primary dependent axis, such as two-theta detector. This field must exist (or be linked) in this :ref:`NXdata` group.

attribute.name: axes
attribute.doc:
name(s) of the field(s) for plotting the data, typically the first column for 1-D scans
These are the independent axes, such as positioners. For 2-D or higher dimension data, there will be a field named for each dimension, separated by ":" (preferred) or "," or " " (whitespace).
Such as for 2-D data plotted against *energy* and *th*::
@axes = energy:th
This(these) field(s) must exist (or be linked) in this :ref:`NXdata` group.

attribute.name: AXISNAME_indices

field.name: data
field.doc:
one column of data from the scan
HDF5 requires that each member of a group must have a unique name.
Pick the name of column from **#L** but make it unique which means if the same name is used in more than one column, append a number to the extra instances to make them unique yet preserve their content, just in case they might be different.
Example: ``seconds seconds`` becomes ``seconds`` and ``seconda_1``.

attribute.name: spec_name
attribute.doc: name as specified in **#L** line, before it was made unique for HDF5

attribute.name: units
attribute.doc: Unless stated otherwise, units (not declared in the SPEC data file) are assumed to be *counts* for detectors and "unknown" for positioners or other scan columns.

field.name: intensity_factor
field.doc: **#I** -- intensity normalizing factor

group.name: counter_cross_reference
group.doc: associates values declared in **#J** and **#j** scan header lines

group.name: positioner_cross_reference
group.doc: associates values declared in **#O** and **#o** scan header lines

group.name: spec
group.doc: various metadata from the SPEC scan header that have well-known NeXus base clases

group.name: UB
group.doc: Orientation matrix of single crystal sample using Busing-Levy convention

field.name: orientation_matrix
field.doc: **#G3** line in scan header

group.name: G
group.doc:
SPEC geometry variables for this diffractometer geometry (instrument specific)
TODO: give interpreted name for each array value (need to figure out how to get the names)

field.name: G0
field.doc: geometry parameters from G[] array (geo mode, sector, etc)

field.name: G1
field.doc: geometry parameters from U[] array (lattice constants, orientation reflections)

field.name: G2
field.doc: not used, although some files has a single zero value

field.name: G4
field.doc: geometry parameters from Q[] array (lambda, frozen angles, cut points, etc)

group.name: positioners
group.doc: names and values of all positioners (**#O** and **#P** lines) in scan header

field.name: positioner
field.doc:
one positioner from the scan header
HDF5 requires that each member of a group must have a unique name.
SPEC assigns a unique name to each positioner, no extra work is neccesary to comply with the HDF5 rule for unique names in a group.

group.name: MCA
group.doc: **#@CALIB** -- coefficients to compute a scale based on the MCA channel number

field.name: roiN
field.doc: numbered regions of interest, use an index number as part of the name

group.name: metadata
group.doc:
SPEC metadata (UNICAT-style #H and #V lines)
This is a block that may be unique to SPEC files acquired at certain APS beam lines. Other facilities or instruments may use this block for storing key:value pairs of data where the values have suitable attributes (such as units).

field.name: SPEC_user
field.doc: user name from first **#C** line in file header

group.name: _unrecognized
group.doc: Fallback for any SPEC data file control lines not otherwise placed into groups or fields elsewhere in this specification.
